content.en: MRI-based Alzheimer's detection: Researchers are exploring the use of automated computer algorithms to accurately detect Alzheimer's disease (AD) using MRI scans. These algorithms, such as support vector machines (SVM) and machine learning models, analyze various features of the brain scans to differentiate between AD and control subjects. By optimizing feature selection and classification methods, these algorithms show promise in aiding in the early diagnosis of AD and differentiating between normal aging, mild cognitive impairment (MCI), and AD.
content.da: MR-baseret Alzheimers detektion: Forskere undersøger brugen af automatiserede computeralgoritmer til nøjagtig detektion af Alzheimers sygdom (AD) ved hjælp af MR-scanninger. Disse algoritmer, såsom support vector machines (SVM) og maskinlæringsmodeller, analyserer forskellige træk ved hjernescanningerne for at skelne mellem AD og kontrolpersoner. Ved at optimere udvælgelse af træk og klassificeringsmetoder, viser disse algoritmer lovende resultat i at hjælpe med tidlig diagnose af AD og skelne mellem normal aldring, mild kognitiv svækkelse (MCI) og AD.
